summary: An FBI email from July 16, 2019, regarding the Epstein investigation, coordinating an interview with a victim in Fort Lauderdale and referencing the Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad.

persons.name: TFO II
persons.context: Addressee of the email, being informed about an upcoming victim interview.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Addressee of the email, being informed about an upcoming victim interview.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: Sender of the email from Squad C-20 (Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking) at the FBI New York office.

connections.description: Supervisory Special Agent communicating with a Special Agent regarding investigation coordination.
Supervisory Special Agent communicating with a Task Force Officer regarding investigation coordination.
Supervisory Special Agent communicating with an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding investigation coordination.

events.title: Planned Victim Interview in Fort Lauderdale
events.description: An FBI agent will be in Fort Lauderdale to conduct an interview with a victim related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The email is dated July 16, 2019, during the active investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
The communication is from the FBI's New York-based Squad C-20, which handles Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking.
It coordinates an upcoming victim interview to be conducted in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.
The recipients include an FBI Special Agent (SA), a Task Force Officer II (TFO II), and an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA), indicating a multi-agency investigative effort.
